eu.smartdatalake.simsearch

Class Assistant

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.smartdatalake.simsearch.Assistant

  • public class Assistant
extends java.lang.Object
    Auxiliary class that provides various helper methods.

        public Assistant()
        Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • descOperation

        public java.lang.String descOperation(int op)
        Provides the textual description of the type of operation with the given number.
        Parameters:
        op - The numeric identifier of the requested operation (0: CATEGORICAL_TOPK; 1:SPATIAL_KNN ; 2:NUMERICAL_TOPK).
        Returns:
        A string describing the type of the operation.

      • getColumnNumber

        public int getColumnNumber(java.lang.String inputFile,
                           java.lang.String colName,
                           java.lang.String columnDelimiter)
        Identifies which column in the header of the input CSV file corresponds to the given attribute name.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - The input CSV file.
        attrValue - The attribute name.
        columnDelimiter - The delimiter character in the CSV file.
        Returns:
        An integer >=0 representing the ordering of the column in the file; -1, if this attribute name is not found in the header.

      • getColumnNumber

        public int getColumnNumber(java.lang.String dataSource,
                           java.lang.String colName,
                           JdbcConnector jdbcConnector)
        Identifies which column in the database table corresponds to the given attribute name.
        Parameters:
        dataSource - The database table.
        attrValue - The attribute name.
        jdbcConnector - A connection instance to the database.
        Returns:
        An integer >=0 representing the ordering of the column in the table; -1, if this attribute name is not found.

      • isJDBCColumnIndexed

        public boolean isJDBCColumnIndexed(java.lang.String dataSource,
                                   java.lang.String colName,
                                   JdbcConnector jdbcConnector)
        Identifies whether the given column in the database table has an associated index (numerical, spatial, textual).
        Parameters:
        dataSource - The database table.
        attrValue - The attribute name.
        jdbcConnector - A connection instance to the database.
        Returns:
        True, if an index exists in this column; otherwise, False.

      • arrayJSON2String

        public java.lang.String[] arrayJSON2String(org.json.simple.JSONArray jsonArray)
        Converts a JSONArray object into an array of strings.
        Parameters:
        jsonArray - Input JSON array.
        Returns:
        Output array of string values.

      • arrayJSON2Double

        public java.lang.Double[] arrayJSON2Double(org.json.simple.JSONArray jsonArray)
        Provides an array of double numbers as consumed from a JSON array of values.
        Parameters:
        jsonArray - A JSON array of values.
        Returns:
        Output array of double values.

      • formatAttrValue

        public java.lang.String formatAttrValue(java.lang.Object val)
        Formats attribute values to be issued in the reporting results
        Parameters:
        val - The attribute value (numerical, textual, spatial) to be formatted.
        Returns:
        The formatted string.

      • formatURL

        public java.lang.String formatURL(java.lang.String prefixURL,
                                  java.lang.String id)
        Format entity identifiers as URL for the final results
        Parameters:
        prefixURL - The HTTP prefix to be used.
        id - The identifier of the entity
        Returns:
        A resolvable URL to be used as entity identifier for a similarity search result.

      • tokenize

        public TokenSet tokenize(java.lang.String id,
                         java.lang.String keywords,
                         java.lang.String tokDelimiter)
        Tokenizes the given string of keywords using a specific character as delimiter. FIXME: This method is also specified in the CategoricalValueFinder class.
        Parameters:
        id - Identifier of this collection of keywords.
        keywords - A string containing keywords.
        tokDelimiter - The delimiter character between keywords.
        Returns:
        A set of tokens (keywords).
